roadmap.title: Roadmap
roadmap.locked: Sign in and complete the test to view your personal roadmap
roadmap.personalMessage: Your roadmap has been personalized based on your level in each algorithm.
roadmap.onboardingSteps.title: How to Start Right?
roadmap.onboardingSteps.hint: Don't worry if you don't know anything yet, your guide is here to start you step by step.
roadmap.onboardingSteps.step1.title: Choose your language based on your interests
roadmap.onboardingSteps.step1.descriptio: Don't waste your time with confusion! What's important is your way of thinking, not the language.
This is the 'queen' in this field. Very fast and has libraries containing helpful tools that make competitions easier, and also useful in fields like game development and robotics design.

Easy and excellent for beginners, but sometimes a bit slow with heavy problems. However, it's the most suitable choice for beginners because it's closest to human language, and it's the foundation for building AI models and enters many fields like data analysis.
A strong and balanced option in demand in the market (similar to C++).
roadmap.onboardingSteps.step2.title: Master Your Basics
roadmap.onboardingSteps.step2.descriptio: Before diving deep, you need to master your tools first. Learn these things well:
roadmap.onboardingSteps.step2.basics.env: Install a program like VS Code and start with it, or you can use websites like Programiz to begin.
roadmap.onboardingSteps.step2.basics.con: What are Variables, If conditions, and Loops.
roadmap.onboardingSteps.step2.basics.fun: So your code becomes organized and doesn't get messy.
roadmap.onboardingSteps.step2.basics.arr: How to store and handle data.
roadmap.onboardingSteps.step3.title: Proper Training
roadmap.onboardingSteps.step3.descriptio: Programming doesn't work theoretically! You need to solve with your own hands, make mistakes, and learn. This is the most important step.
roadmap.onboardingSteps.step3.assiut.des: This is a treasure for beginners (available on the Codeforces platform). It's a collection of organized problems that take you from 'print your name' to problems that require thinking.
roadmap.onboardingSteps.step3.assiut.tip: Tips for maximum benefit from Assiut Sheets:
Focus on understanding the core idea of the problem, not memorizing solution steps.
Always look for patterns and recurring relationships within the data.
Ask yourself why the solution works this way, not just how it works.
Start by analyzing simple cases to expand the idea before moving to generalization.
Break the problem into clear, interconnected steps to facilitate systematic thinking.
Use illustrations or tables when needed to simplify complex relationships.
Test the solution on the given examples in the question, then on additional examples to ensure correct understanding.
Rely on logical thinking and analysis, not on memorizing ready-made patterns.
There are also excellent global platforms to solidify basics and get used to solving online:
An amazing site to strengthen the basics of the language you chose.
You can solve easy problems on it (search by Tag: 800 Difficulty).
Excellent for beginners, I recommend following the monthly contests on it.
Note: Codeforces is considered the most important site in this field, so try to get used to it, and here's a tutorial on using the site so you know how to work on it:

footer.description: Your comprehensive platform for learning competitive programming

terms.title: Terms of Use & Academic Integrity
terms.intro.title: 1. Platform Purpose & Agreement
terms.intro.content: Dalil is a specialized educational environment dedicated to algorithms and competitive programming. Accessing or using our services implies a binding agreement to these Terms. We aim to foster a community based on respect, learning, and technical excellence.
terms.accounts.title: 2. User Responsibility & Verification
terms.accounts.creation: Registered users are entitled to personalized roadmaps and progression tracking. You agree to provide accurate email and identity information.
terms.accounts.username: Usernames must maintain professional standards; offensive, impersonating, or purely commercial names are subject to modification or removal.
terms.accounts.security: You are the sole custodian of your account. Any activity performed under your credentials remains your legal responsibility.
terms.use.title: 3. Acceptable Conduct & Ethical Coding
terms.use.educational: Dalil is designed for skill building and legitimate competitive practice.
terms.use.prohibited: The following are strictly prohibited: (a) Submitting plagiarized solutions in curated challenges, (b) Harassment of community members, (c) Automated scraping of problem data, (d) Exploiting platform vulnerabilities. Violation results in immediate disqualification from leaderboards.
terms.content.title: 4. Intellectual Property Rights
terms.content.platform: All original curriculum, algorithm visualizations, and proprietary assessment logic are protected under copyright and remain the property of Dalil.
terms.content.user: Users grant Dalil a non-exclusive license to display their solution statistics, public profile data, and leaderboard standing to facilitate the social learning aspect of the platform.
terms.gamification.title: 5. Gamification & Skill Representation
terms.gamification.content: Points, badges, and levels are internal motivational indicators. While they reflect effort, they do not serve as official academic certifications or employment guarantees from external entities.
terms.mod.title: 6. Oversight & Compliance
terms.mod.content: Our administrative team maintains the right to audit activity, reset point discrepancies caused by exploits, and transition accounts to 'inactive' if Terms are breached.
terms.availability.title: 7. Service Continuity
terms.availability.content: We aim for 99% uptime; however, Dalil is provided 'as is'. We are not liable for data loss during scheduled maintenance or unforeseen technical disruptions.
terms.changes.title: 8. Amendments
terms.changes.content: These Terms may evolve. Continued use of the platform after updates constitutes acceptance of the revised policies.
terms.contact.title: 9. Support & Community Governance
terms.contact.content: For inquiries regarding these terms or to report violations, please engage with our administration via the official Discord community or designated support channels.
privacy.title: Data Privacy Policy
privacy.collect.title: 1. Data Collection & Purpose
privacy.collect.account: Identity: User-provided email, chosen username, and avatar URL.
privacy.collect.activity: Engagement: Detailed tracking of roadmap progress, problem-solving timestamps, and leaderboard point accrual.
privacy.use.title: 2. Data Utilization
privacy.use.content: Collected data is primarily used to generate personal roadmaps, facilitate competitive features (leaderboards), and improve the educational content suggested to you.
privacy.public.title: 3. Transparency & Visibility
privacy.public.content: To maintain a competitive spirit, usernames, avatars, and educational achievements are visible to other logged-in users. Administrative accounts are flagged and excluded from public rankings to maintain competitive integrity.
privacy.cookies.title: 4. Local Persistence & Session Management
privacy.cookies.content: We utilize browser LocalStorage and minimal session cookies to persist your authentication, language preferences, and interface theme settings.
privacy.storage.title: 5. Secure Infrastructure
privacy.storage.content: Our data is managed via Supabase, utilizing robust encryption and secure cloud protocols. We do not store plain-text passwords.
privacy.sharing.title: 6. Third-Party Restrictions
privacy.sharing.content: Your data is never sold or leased. We do not share identity information with external marketing agencies or trackers.
privacy.deletion.title: 7. Right to Erasure
privacy.deletion.content: Users may request complete account deletion. This process removes all identity data and solved problem history from our active records.
privacy.children.title: 8. Age Requirements
privacy.children.content: Dalil is intended for students and professional learners. We comply with standard privacy protections and do not knowingly collect data from unsupervised minors.
privacy.updates.title: 9. Policy Revisions
privacy.updates.content: Material changes to our privacy practices will be communicated through site-wide notifications or direct email alerts.
notFound.title: Page Not Found
notFound.message: Sorry, the page you're looking for doesn't exist
doc_hero_title: Programming: The Language of the Modern Era
doc_hero_subtitle: Programming today isn't a "niche field" for a certain group. It's an essential skill for anyone regardless of their specialization, as it has entered every field of life. Medicine, engineering, accounting, business, content creation, education... everything now relies on technology in one way or another.
card_web_desc: The websites and applications you use every day are all built with lines of code.
card_mobile_desc: Android and iOS.. How an idea in your head can become an app in the hands of millions.
card_ai_desc: How machines learn to think, analyze data, and predict what will happen in the future.
card_all_desc: Even doctors, engineers, and accountants need it to simplify their work and solve their complex problems.
ps_text: You might think that learning a language like Python or C++ is the goal, but the truth is the language is just a "tool" like a pen. What distinguishes a beginner from a professional is the skill of Problem Solving. Without it, you'll just be a "code writer" not a "software engineer" who understands the whole picture.
step1_ps_desc: How to divide a big problem into small pieces you can handle.
step2_ps_desc: Draw a "plan" of the solution in your mind or on paper before writing any code.
step3_ps_desc: Translate this plan into a language the computer understands.
gym_text: That's why competitive programming is the "gym" where you'll train your programming brain muscles.
cp_def: A mental sport.. Programmers compete to solve complex programming problems within a limited time and specific conditions.
benefit1_title: Academic Excellence and Stronger University Opportunities
benefit1_desc: Algorithms give you a competitive advantage inside and outside university. Problem-solving skills are required in all STEM fields, and over time open doors to participate in competitions like ICPC, Google Hash Code, which many students have received scholarships and research opportunities through.
benefit2_title: Your Path to Global Companies and Careers
benefit2_desc: Companies like Microsoft, Amazon, Meta, Google don't just ask about programming languages. They want to assess your ability for logical thinking, handling pressure, and finding optimal solutions under stress, all through Problem Solving questions. The stronger your algorithm skills, the better your chances of passing executive interviews and entering FAANG companies or any strong global company.
benefit3_title: Enhancing Practical Intelligence and Speed of Understanding
benefit3_desc: Problem solving is a thinking school that makes you: faster at dealing with patterns, better at analyzing any problem, having organized and sequential thinking, solving any problem with clear steps instead of randomness. Meaning: you develop the way of thinking itself, not just programming skills.
benefit4_title: Cleaner Code, More Precise Solutions, and Professional Thinking
benefit4_desc: Algorithm skills make you write code that is: faster, cleaner, fewer errors, easier to maintain (Optimization) and addresses the problem in the best possible way. This type of thinking is what distinguishes a professional programmer from anyone who "knows how to write code".
benefit5_desc: Whether you're interested in artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, robotics, game development, data analysis, or even e-commerceâ€”all are built on algorithms. With digital transformation, anyone with this skill definitely has a stronger future and greater opportunities, because they understand how technology works.
benefit6_title: Strengthening Thinking, Creativity, and Solving Life Problems
benefit6_desc: The beauty of this skill is that it doesn't teach you to "memorize", but to "think". You'll find innovative solutions, connect things quickly, think in methodical steps. A skill that benefits you in studying, working, and even daily life.
basics_why_title: Why is Starting with the Basics Important?
basics_why_text: The path we're guiding you through isn't a "magic solution" or a shortcut. It's a series of studied steps that give you a strong foundation in programming... a foundation that allows you to expand and excel in the field you love, whether it's: artificial intelligence, web development, cybersecurity, data science, or even a non-technical field. Because those with a solid foundation... can excel in any branch they choose.
doc_conclusion_text: Programming isn't a goal in itself, it's a "tool". A tool that makes you think better, solve problems faster, and create solutions no one has thought of. And every step you learn here is part of the foundation that will open the door to the specialization you love....
comp_intro: Participating in programming competitions is the best way to test and develop your skills. Whether you're a school or university student, there are competitions that suit your level:
comp_ic_text: A competition organized by the Ministry of Education for problem solving
comp_afpc_text: A competition held in Jordan - Applied Science University, bringing together school students from Arab countries to compete in problem solving
comp_ioi_text: The biggest competition for school students in problem solving at a global level, you could call it the "World Cup of Problem Solving for School Students"
comp_hcj_desc: A programming competition held at Hebron University, bringing together students from various national universities to solve problems.
comp_pcpc_desc: The official competition for Palestinian universities, with winners qualifying for the Arab competition.
comp_acpc_desc: A major regional competition featuring the best Arab university teams, with winners qualifying for the global competition.
comp_icpc_desc: The world's largest university competition for problem solving, bringing together the world's geniuses in problem solving.
comp_topcoder_desc: One of the oldest competition platforms
comp_tip1_text: Participating in your school or university competitions gives you initial experience.
comp_tip2_text: Solve problems from Codeforces, LeetCode, and CodeChef regularly.
comp_tip3_text: Working in a team develops collaboration and communication skills.
comp_tip4_text: After each competition, review the solutions and learn from mistakes.
comp_tip5_text: Each failed competition is a step toward success in the next one.
comp_final_note: Final expectation: The more you practice, the better you get. Additionally, participating in programming competitions has a significant impact on personal development professionally and academically, and expanding your network.
community_intro: Join our active community on Discord! Share your experiences, ask questions, and be part of the competitive programming community. Development isn't easy alone, but with the community it will be easier and more fun!

flowchart.title: Flowcharts
flowchart.subtitle: Learn flowchart basics before diving into algorithms
flowchart.description: Learn how to draw and understand flowcharts before starting with algorithms
flowchart.intro.title: Introduction to Flowcharts
flowchart.intro.whatIsDesc: A flowchart is a visual representation of sequential steps to solve a problem or execute an algorithm. It uses different geometric shapes to represent different types of operations, making it easier to understand program flow.
flowchart.intro.reason1: Helps you think logically and organize your thoughts before writing code
flowchart.intro.reason2: Makes complex algorithms easier to understand through visual representation
flowchart.intro.reason3: A universal language understood by programmers worldwide
flowchart.intro.exampleDesc: To calculate the sum of two numbers: Start â†’ Read two numbers â†’ Calculate sum â†’ Print result â†’ End
flowchart.exercise.dragElementsHere: Drag elements here to build the flowchart
flowchart.exercise.tip: Tip: You can drag elements OR tap to select and place them.
